caption: It is a very nice museum to know about the history of La Poste ( Postal Service of France). You can see all the stamps produced by France till now since the last 2 centuries. The museum was really fascinating and interesting and the ticket is also really less so a person must visit this place. You can see a lot of older technology as well.

I love everything post office so this museum is really perfect!! I love stamps and here are stamps. Letters and uniforms - mailboxes (yes, I have a fascination with yellow so I like it even more!). The staff are lovely and especially the lady at the souvenir counter, never met anyone cuter than her!
A nice and quiet museum! They had some very lovely displays; I especially loved the stamp collection room. An additional plus: even on a Saturday afternoon, it was relatively quiet.

Just awesome!  3 floors of geek extravaganza!  You will see the whole history of the France and the world üåç postal service.  The wall with post stamps is huge and takes the whole room. I spent long time just to see them all.  They also have a small gift shop, where I purchased socks with La Poste branding and a piggy bank üòÖ

29 of September i visited their, it's really helpful to achieve knowledge, haw the France communicate and which way lapost send or receive  latter. the strongly managed their latter communication system. it's free of cost. you can prebook by internet. üôè Thanks ‚Ä¶

Very quite. Very interesting. All the display notes are in french, hence for non-francophones, have to use Google translate to help in understanding the display. The boutique counter also serves as a post office, that provides special cachet.
Very cool museum retracing the history of postal services. Visit takes 2 hours.
Highly recommend for lovers of postcard and the history de la Poste , interesting exhibition and boutique

Amazing place! Totally worth a visit, the staff is so nice and the visit is rich. There's also this game you can play while you visit the various floors and if you win it they'll get you a nice free gift. Not very popular, but became one of my overall favourite museums.
A very nice surprise. Also the price is very good. If u got time it can be a trip in the past ‚ù§Ô∏è  Don t forget: @safiticuminti - instagram
Interesting place! Recommendable to visit. You will learn a lot. Big and clean.  They are kind and good service.
I love this museum! You can learn about the history of the post in Paris and there‚Äôs a really nice gift shop that sells stamps from around the world! Free for under 26.

We went there with our boys on a Sunday afternoon because it‚Äôs the closest museum to our place and I thought it would be interesting but that‚Äôs it!  Well, I stand corrected because I loved it and I‚Äôm looking forward to going back to have more time to read all the descriptions.  Whoever managed the redesign of this museum did a fantastic job!
Everything are in French, nothing in English, not very convenient for international visitors

It's really nice and interesting modern place to see. The museum provides historical time course of development of the posts via several ways. The Stuffs are polite as well. They provide the device to get information in English. I had pleasure a lot.
One of the best museums in Paris.
Such an interesting Museum on the history of the french Postal service.  It's free on Sundays and the souvenir shop has a post machine.  So it's the one place you can send post from on a Sunday XD
Amazing place! No crowds, cheap tickets, and a charming exhibition, friendly staff.
Its a nicely designed museum, lots of information if you like post history that is. For 5 euros its worth the visit.
More informative , recently renovation, guides were explaining very nicely. More information on how to posts has been transported from the initial stage along with stamps, post boxes.
A little gem. No crowds, cheap tickets, charming exhibition. Super view of Paris from the top floor.
Hidden gem in Paris. Nostalgic and touching for those who know the beauty of analogue communication in 20th century.
Fantastic, a true surprise and the friendliest staff. I will recommend to everyone I know!
New museum and a hidden gem, well worth a visit. Take Google Translate you'll need it.
Nice museum but sadly not a single line of English.

It‚Äôs now open, and everything‚Äôs brand new there, all nice and smooth, friendly staff etc... but how‚Äôs this possible to not have anything in English? Hard to think of the logic behind that decision.
is this the same address of this one ( 34 Bd de Vaugirard, 75731 Paris, cedex 15, France ) if not how i can find it
Good museum
Super
Very interesting

Pretty museum, quite quiet (and free entry for those under 26), it takes at least 1 hour to go around. There is plenty to learn about the history of the post office. The museum team is very friendly and the shop is complete with lots of goodies for fans of the post

``Postal Museum'' Mus√©e de La Poste A museum where you can trace the evolution of the French postal service. It is located near Gare Montparnasse station and the entrance fee is 5‚Ç¨. There are also lockers and a museum shop.  With over 1 million stamps from the past to the present, it's truly France! There are many stylish and cool designs.  Display of mailboxes and delivery personnel's uniforms, mail planes, airships, ships, and trains. I was excited to see it. I couldn't help but laugh out loud at the comedic short film (silent) booth. This is a museum that can be enjoyed by both adults and children.

The museum is awesome!! It is very complete, very interesting. The scenography is readable, pleasant and easy to follow. The staff is very nice, the lady at reception welcomed us very well and explained the route to us with a lot of enthusiasm and kindness. There was a quiz game, which I found really fun. The lady in the shop was also very pleasant. I think it's one of the best museums in Paris

A very beautiful and large place. The welcome is warm. On the ground floor there is a temporary exhibition not to be missed concerning the marathon. The permanent collection is very informative and rich in emotions. On the first floor there is a shop with a wide choice of souvenirs to offer or treat yourself.

Came with my 5 year old son. They approached us in a different way. He loved vehicles: trains, planes, bikes, etc., and the many audio animations to listen to. Me the richness of the collection, the interactivity and the detailed explanations We learned a lot in a fun way.

This is another museum that deserves to be known. An exhibition on three floors with elevators for disabled access and a museum shop with eco-friendly products. The exhibition is full of history and rich in anecdotes, as well as period pieces. There is even an interactive game for younger children that parents and grandparents with a slightly adventurous temperament can also use. A very good time spent in this place where we were also very well received. THANKS

A very interesting museum which tells the history of La Poste, from the 15th century to the present day. Incredible to learn that hot air balloons, men in very big boots riding galloping horses and pneumatic pipes were used to deliver the mail. A captivating museum for all ages.
A great visit to the museum to do with or without a guide.  Postal history is faithfully reconstructed.  Easy to access by public transport.
